item.title: RuneScape: Dragonwilds - How to Make Hard Leather
item.description:
Hard Leather is an advanced crafting material in RuneScape: Dragonwilds. It is a processed material, which means instead of getting it by defeating enemies or hunting monsters, players will need to rely on their crafting stations to make it.

The recipe for Hard Leather is unlocked as soon as the first Adhesive is obtained; however, crafting it can be confusing for a lot of players because, while the crafting station required for it—the Tannery—only appears to take one material at a time, the recipe asks for two ingredients.

How to Craft Hard Leather in RuneScape: Dragonwilds

Hard Leather can be crafted at a Tannery that has been upgraded with a Tanner’s Kit. Its recipe is:

  • Crafting Station: Tannery (Upgraded with Tanner’s Kit)
  • Recipe: Leather x2 + Adhesive x1 = Hard Leather x1

Leather can be obtained by processing Animal Hide or Animal Hide Scraps in a Tannery. Adhesive can be obtained by processing Swamp Tar (found in Whispering Swamp) in a Kiln.

The Tannery is a basic crafting station that’s available very early on; however, by default, it only allows for one input, meaning players cannot use it to make Hard Leather in this state. To make Hard Leather, you will first have to upgrade the Tannery using a Tanner’s Kit.

How to Get a Tanning Kit (Upgrade Tannery) in RuneScape: Dragonwilds

The Tanner’s Kit can be crafted using the following materials.

  • Bronze Bar x6
  • Coarse Thread x8
  • Adhesive x6
  • Ash Planks x18
In order to upgrade the Tannery, place the Tanner's Kit directly next to the Tannery. You can easily tell when the improvement has taken effect by checking the inputs in the Tannery. With the Tanner's Kit improvemnt, it will have two inputs instead of one.

The recipe for Tanner's Kit will automatically be unlocked as you gather the required ingredients.

Bronze Bar Recipe

  • Crafting Station: Furnace.
  • Recipe: Copper Ore x3 + Tin Ore x3 = Bronze Bar x1

Copper and Tin Ore can be found in the Fractured Plains area, north of the Whispering Swamp, in the form of nodes. You can only mine them using a Bone Pickaxe (or by using Rocky Explosion with a Bone Pickaxe equipped).

Coarse Thread Recipe

  • Crafting Station: Spinning Wheel
  • Recipe 1: Flax x1 = Coarse Thread x1
  • Recipe 2: Coarse Animal Fur x3 = Coarse Thread x1

Flax can be found in abundance in the Bramblemead Valley.

Adhesive Recipe

  • Crafting Station: Kiln
  • Recipe: Swamp Tar x1 = Adhesive x1

Swamp Tar can be found in the Whispering Swamp.

Ash Planks Recipe

  • Crafting Station: Sawmill
  • Recipe: Ash Log x1 = Ash Plank x2
5 Images

item.title: Genshin Impact: Hidden Chests In Basin of Unnumbered Flames & Coatepec Mountain
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Hidden Chest 1 Location
  • Hidden Chest 2 Location
  • Hidden Chest 3 Location
  • Hidden Chest 4 Location
  • Hidden Chest 5 Location
  • Hidden Chest 6 Location
  • Hidden Chest 7 Location

Despite having multiple sub-regions in Natlan, the Basin of Unnumbered Flames and Coatepec Mountain are two memorable areas for Genshin Impact players. It’s where players are first introduced to the Pyro Archon and the second tribe they familiarized themselves with.

And, similar to other areas, these two sub-regions also have their own fair share of hidden chests for players to find. There are seven chests in total between these two regions , and it’s advised that Genshin Impact players make sure all the teleport waypoints are unlocked to make travel easier.

Hidden Chest 1 Location

Teleport to the waypoint shown in the above image and turn right to find some warriors near a rock. Defeat them and you’ll receive the hidden chest.

Hidden Chest 2 Location

Teleport to the waypoint toward the far right of the Basin of Unnumbered Flames and glide toward the hilichurl you see to your left. There will be a small unlit campfire next to him, so all you need to do is use pyro to light it up, and you’ll get a chest.

Hidden Chest 3 Location

Teleport to the Statue of Seven at the Basin of Unnumbered Flames and head toward the herd of alpacas you see to your left. In the middle of them, you’ll see some Sunsettias . Pick all of them, and a chest should appear.

Hidden Chest 4 Location

This chest is close to the previous location, so all you need to do is head toward a campsite enshrouded in a bush . You’ll see some eggs lying in the middle of it, and if you grab all of them, some warriors will spawn. Defeat all the warriors and you’ll receive a chest.

Hidden Chest 5 Location

Teleport to the waypoint near the Scions of the Canopy tribe and head left toward a rock. There are some apples lying right next to it, and you need to grab all of them first before jumping down to pick up the two crystal beetles right below them. Then, investigate the glowing spot, and a chest will pop up.

Hidden Chest 6 Location

For this chest, teleport to the Scions of the Canopy Statue of Seven and turn left to climb up the mountain beside it. You can use the Saurian, Kachina, or Xilonen to help you out. Once up there, look for a stone surrounded by crystal ore . Break it, and a Lava Avatar should appear. Defeating it will spawn the chest.

Hidden Chest 7 Location

This final chest is over at the Ancestral Temple waypoint . You need to teleport to the one in the center, turn around, and jump down toward the slimes you see near the crystal ore. Defeat them, and a Lava Avatar will appear again. Defeating the lava avatar will then give you a precious chest.

item.title: All Pokemon Scarlet & Violet Codes (April 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Working Pokemon Scarlet & Violet Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes for Pokemon Scarlet & Violet

By using the games' Mystery Gift mechanic, Pokemon Scarlet & Violet players can get their hands on all manner of great in-game rewards. These typically range from rare or hard-to-find items to brand-new Pokemon; all of which can help players on their journey toward being the very best. However, it's important to note that Pokemon Scarlet & Violet codes don't last forever, so players should be sure to redeem them before it's too late.

The following guide contains all of the working codes for Pokemon Scarlet & Violet , as well as step-by-step instructions on how to redeem them. We'll update it whenever new Pokemon SV codes are released by the developers, so fans of the franchise may want to consider bookmarking this page and checking it from time to time to avoid missing out on future freebies.

Updated April 19, 2025, by Tom Bowen : A new Pokemon Scarlet & Violet code has just been released to celebrate the ongoing Pokemon Asia Championship Series. By redeeming the code R1LLAB00M2024TW , players can get a Fateful Encounter Rillaboom at Level 50. After doing so, they should take a moment or two to bookmark this page and check back here often, as we're constantly on the lookout for new Pokemon SV codes and will update the table below with any that we find.

All Working Pokemon Scarlet & Violet Codes

Code

Reward

Expiry Date

R1LLAB00M2024TW

Wei Chyr's Rillaboom (Level 50)

July 31st, 2025

ELEMENTST0NES

Fire Stone (1), Thunder Stone (1), Water Stone (1), Leaf Stone (1), Ice Stone (1)

January 1st, 2026

C0SM1CST0NES

Sun Stone (1), Moon Stone (1), Shiny Stone (1), Dusk Stone (1), Dawn Stone (1)

January 1st, 2026

V1TAM1NS

HP Up Zinc (2), Protein Zinc (2), Iron Zinc (2), Carbos Zinc (2), Calcium Zinc (2), Zinc (2)

January 1st, 2026

P4LD3AP1CN1C

Sandwich Ingredients Gift

January 19th, 2026

NE0R0T0MC0VER

Kitakami Rotom Phone Cover

N/A

SB00KC0VER

Pokemon Scarlet Rotom Phone Cover (Scarlet Exclusive)

N/A

VB00KC0VER

Pokemon Violet Rotom Phone Cover (Violet Exclusive)

N/A

N/A (Get via Internet)

Mythical Pecha Berry

N/A

How to Redeem Codes for Pokemon Scarlet & Violet

Redeeming codes for Pokemon Scarlet & Violet is remarkably simple, though there are a few things that players will need to keep in mind. For starters, they'll need to be connected to the internet in order to claim their rewards. They'll also need to pay attention to the redemption method. Certain rewards can be claimed without a code simply by choosing the "Get via Internet" option. Assuming there is a code though, they'll need to follow the steps below in order to redeem it:

  1. Press the X button to open up the menu and then navigate to the Poke Portal .
  2. Choose the Mystery Gift option followed by Get with Code/Password .
  3. Type in the code using the on-screen keyboard and then press the OK button .
  4. Confirm the gift by pressing the A button , then wait a few moments for it to download.

Players will not need a Nintendo Switch Online subscription to redeem codes for Pokemon Scarlet & Violet .

item.title: Doom: The Dark Ages Fans Need to Keep an Eye on April 20
item.description:
Summary

  • Trailer 2 for Doom: The Dark Ages arrives Sunday, April 20, following a TV spot premiere during WWE WrestleMania 41.
  • Doom: The Dark Ages is releasing May 15 and will be a day one Xbox Game Pass release.

Doom: The Dark Ages Trailer 2 will be dropping on Sunday, April 20. Doom: The Dark Ages is the next installment in the long-running first-person shooter franchise from id Software and Bethesda. A prequel to the 2016 Doom game, Doom: The Dark Ages features a medieval setting and a greater focus on grounded combat when compared to its predecessors.

Doom: The Dark Ages is easily one of the most highly-anticipated new game releases of the year. Doom: The Dark Ages previews have been glowing, and it's looking like the game will be one of the biggest day one Game Pass games of 2025. Doom: The Dark Ages has looked very impressive so far, and now fans know exactly when they will get to see more of the game.

Trailer 2 for Doom: The Dark Ages will drop on Sunday, April 20. First, fans will be treated to the world premiere of the game's TV spot during WWE WrestleMania 41 Night 2, with the full trailer to be posted online afterward. WrestleMania 41 Night 2 will be airing live on Peacock starting at 6pm CT on Sunday, so those that want to see new footage of Doom: The Dark Ages ASAP will want to tune in to the show.

When is the Next Trailer for Doom: The Dark Ages?

  • Sunday, April 20

Previous Doom: The Dark Ages footage has shown off the game's new weapons, like the jaw-dropping Shield Saw, as well as the dragon that players will be able to fly in the game. Doom: The Dark Ages ' previous trailer has already set the tone that the new game is going all out, and so it will be very interesting to see what Trailer 2 brings to the table.

The good news is that anyone excited to play Doom: The Dark Ages for themselves won't have to wait all that much longer. Doom: The Dark Ages ' release date is scheduled for May 15, with the game set to be available as a day one Xbox Game Pass game. Those that buy the Premium Upgrade ($34.99 or $31.49 for Game Pass Ultimate subscribers) will secure 2-days early access to the game, allowing them to check out Doom: The Dark Ages on May 13 instead. Regardless, Doom: The Dark Ages ' release date is nearly upon us, and hopefully Trailer 2 is able to whet fans' appetites in the meantime.

item.title: Stardew Valley Players Have Likely Never Seen Three Furniture Items
item.description:
Stardew Valley has many hidden mysteries that players must unravel. Some of these oddities are more difficult to uncover than others, leaving many players left in the dark while only a select few have managed to find them. ConcernedApe has made sure to leave plenty of puzzles for Stardew Valley players to solve, something that will hopefully continue in his next title, Haunted Chocolatier . In particular, there are three specific furniture items which require some fierce hunts from Stardew Valley players to acquire.

The hit indie game’s Easter eggs include hidden surprises in Stardew Valley 's intro screen and character creation, various secret items, rare characters, and cryptic messages. Stardew Valley also has its fair share of recurring and interlinked Easter eggs via hidden interactions and items that can be unlocked in the same way. For example, Mayor Lewis’ lucky purple shorts can lead to unique responses from characters, 750-star tokens, a new trimmed version of the lucky purple shorts, and much more depending upon how players interact with the item. For furniture items, though, the Lore Book's statues present a very lofty challenge.

Stardew Valley is No Stranger to Easter Eggs

Stardew Valley ’s secret items are some of the most difficult Easter eggs to uncover. The steps for procuring these secret items are oftentimes very specific and sometimes quite lengthy. There are the more random items that face particular requirements, such as the long list of items players can accidentally fish. This category of secret items is very location-specific, with many items only being available on Ginger Island and so forth.

Secret items with specific requirements can prove much more interesting than these location-exclusive Easter eggs. The Galaxy Sword is one such item, which can be found after finding and donating all four Dwarf Scrolls to the Museum. Players will receive a Dwarvish Translation Guide after completing this mission, which allows for one of the previously unreadable tombstones in the Graveyard to be read, pointing players in the direction of the desert. Standing at the location mentioned in the tombstone while holding a Prismatic Shard will cause it to be transformed into the Galaxy Sword. Another secret item players can receive is the Junimo Plush. Shaking a bush in the northwest corner of Pelican Town on the 28th of any season at exactly noon will add the cute plushy to a player’s inventory.

The Museum's Lost Book and Its Statues

However, no group of secret items highlights this difficulty more than the three statues players can acquire after decoding the Museum’s incomprehensible Lost Book. Like other Stardew Valley Easter eggs, acquiring these three secret statues requires players to decipher a puzzle laid out by ConcernedApe.

How to Find the Three Statues

The first letters in the aforementioned Lost Book form three sequences of three to four words: SUPER CUCUMBER TOWN, DUCK MAYO SALOON, and STRANGE BUN TOY BOX. While these words seem unrelated, each phrase is necessary to help unlock the three secret statues hidden around Pelican Town. In fact, looking at the first two words of each phrase combined with the last word gives players an item and a location. Super Cucumber, Duck Mayonnaise, and Strange Bun are all items that players can acquire by fishing, using the Mayonnaise Machine, and cooking respectively. The location mentioned in the second part of the secret phrases refers to various boxes hidden around Pelican Town.

Placing a Super Cucumber in the brown box located in the fenced area north of the Blacksmith, in Pelican Town, unlocks the “??HMTGF??” statue. Leaving the Duck Mayonnaise in the partly hidden metal box in the back room of the Stardrop Saloon gives players the “??Pinky Lemon??” statue. And finally, placing a Strange Bun in the toy chest in Vincent’s room at 1 Willow Lane unlocks the “??Foroguemon??” statue. Not many players have completed this very specific quest, making these three mysterious statue furniture items something that most Stardew Valley players have never seen.
